Entries.default: "These are strange coins you wager."
"Vailian pires. Merchants don't trade in snail shells if they can avoid it."
"Ekera, but why? Money is just a symbol."
"Do you have money down on that new challenger?"
"Ekera. That one shows great promise."
"The merchants do not care for symbolism, either. Everything must have its own value. That is their way."
"Ninety eight, ninety nine, one hundred. There you go, lucky bastard."
"How is it possible that I lost another bet to you? Are you rigging these fights?"
"Did you see how they laid into Osgar?"
"Good. Now I know to bet against you. You wouldn't know talent if it hurled a javelin through a brass ring."
"I have a feeling about this one. Care to stake some of your outsider coin on it?"
"You're on."
"Much appreciated. How about double or nothing if you let me bet on the contender?"
"I was going to spend that coin on a shield that matches my eyes... but I'll take your little wager."
"Ekera, then may Amira bring great fortune to you, my friend."
"And anger Toamowhai? Never!"
"What if I spent my winnings on some mohorā meat and rum? Would you enjoy it with me... on the beach?"
"Well. I mean. I love mohorā meat. And rum."
"Then it's a yes?"
"I never heard the Quiet Five speak before."
"Those Dragonstalkers used to be a safe bet. What happened?"
"Ekera. His own mother wouldn't recognize him."
"There's a new alpha bear on Kazuwari. That much is certain."
"Ekera, and now you never will."
"The real pity is, I had good coins down on them."
"I'm sure it's a day of mourning for you."
"Did you think they would die of old age? Not in my arena."
"My purse hoped they would succeed. Here's to hoping the newcomer does even better."
"Care to make it interesting?"
